sentences.en: a special screen to reduce glare
sentences.cn: 一种可以减弱刺眼强光的特殊屏幕

sentences.en: A sudden glare of headlights lit the driveway.
sentences.cn: 突然一辆汽车的头灯照亮了车道.

sentences.en: Ah Q would rise to the bait as usual, and glare furiously.
sentences.cn: 阿Q照例地发了怒, 他怒目而视了.

sentences.en: Dark glasses are an effective shield against the glare.
sentences.cn: 墨镜能有效地遮挡强光.

sentences.en: Don't glare at me like that, you deserved the scolding.
sentences.cn: 不要那么瞪着我, 你本该受到训斥的.

sentences.en: He turned his baleful glare on the cowering suspect.
sentences.cn: 他恶毒地盯着那个蜷缩成一团的嫌疑犯.

sentences.en: Norma is said to dislike the glare of publicity.
sentences.cn: 据说诺尔玛不喜欢被人过多关注。

sentences.en: She attacked police in the full glare of TV cameras.
sentences.cn: 她在电视摄像机的镜头聚焦下公然袭击了警察。

sentences.en: She fixed her questioner with an icy glare.
sentences.cn: 她冷冷地盯着审问者.

sentences.en: She gave him a hostile glare.
sentences.cn: 她狠狠地瞪了他一眼。

sentences.en: She glared at him accusingly.
sentences.cn: 她用责备的目光瞪着他。

sentences.en: She looked at him with an angry glare.
sentences.cn: 她生气地瞪着他.

sentences.en: The glare from the fire lit up the sky.
sentences.cn: 火光照亮了天空.

sentences.en: The glare of lights pained one's eyes with their brightness.
sentences.cn: 火光夺目.

sentences.en: The glare of the headlights almost blinded us.
sentences.cn: 汽车前灯耀眼的光使我们睁不开眼.

sentences.en: The mistakes in this report really glare at you.
sentences.cn: 这份报告中的错误真是太明显了.

sentences.en: The old woman glared at him.
sentences.cn: 那个老妇人怒视着他。

sentences.en: The sun glared down on us.
sentences.cn: 刺眼的阳光照在我们身上。

sentences.en: They were in the full glare of publicity.
sentences.cn: 他们大肆炫耀.

sentences.en: Under the glare of the street lamps, visibility was good.
sentences.cn: 在街灯的照射下, 可以看得很清楚.

words.tran_cn: 刺眼；[光]耀眼的光；受公众注目

trans.tran_en: a bright unpleasant light which hurts your eyes
to look angrily at someone for a long time
to shine with a very strong bright light which hurts your eyes
to look angrily at someone for a long time
